item.title: Water level in duck pond fallen drastically, 31st August
item.description:
The water level in the White Webs duck pond has been allowed to fall over past months. The fish are now struggling to survive and some have been found floating dead. One end of the pond now has exposed mud and is turning into grassland due to no water level. The other end of the pond is now barely deep enough for the ducks to swim , they are almost having to walk on the muddy bottom. This situation has been developing for months and is detrimental to the wildlife and amenity of Whitewebs woods.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitewebbs Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4-5 items in park all broken, 31st August
item.description:
It’s the summer holidays and most of the park is unusable due to damage. The zip wire is broken, the climbing rope, the kids rocker and part of the climbing frame missing. We pay numerous amounts of council tax, and these outdoor spaces need repairing. Quick enough to do the tennis courts then start charging for them. It’s just unacceptable that these items have been broken for weeks on end.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned skip and extensive general litter, 31st August
item.description:
There is an apparently abandoned skip piled high with rubbish overflowing on the road, path and lay-by near the entrance to Whitewebs North Lodge entrance..There is also general litter along the whole length of the lay-by. This disgusting mess has been there for some weeks and is getting worse as people seem to be continually adding more rubbish.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitewebbs Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
